name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's loss, @noUpside writes, "has precipitated a deep rift in the right-wing information ecosystem." Media outlets, tech platforms, and commentators have had to choose between upholding reality and pretending that the president really won. https://t.co/f6lIvR3nAC

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week's "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose parents have forbidden him from telling his younger brother that he's gay. https://t.co/YW4zD9FmyP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The question is not whether Trump can pardon himself. It’s whether he can grant himself a pardon," writes @elmunc: https://t.co/bkXSU2rB7c

name: TheAtlantic
text: Netflix’s "Hillbilly Elegy" is an Oscar-friendly narrative of personal triumph in the face of great hardship, a movie designed to end with an uplifting epigraph; it is also one of the worst movies of the year, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/096gTcX7rs

name: TheAtlantic
text: Building a new administration in the span of 11 weeks is a tall order in normal times. But Joe Biden has the added challenge of doing almost all of it virtually, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/x40LrDcwHF

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The Ghost of Christmas Past has much to tell us about what we should expect this year,” @amandamull writes: “Shopping isn’t going anywhere.” https://t.co/SA6ydfoUj6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I see the opportunists and abettors reveling in their transgressions of norms, embracing the chaos, and relishing their own moment in the sun," writes Edward S. Steinfeld of @WatsonInstitute. "Oh, how tantalizing it is to play with fire." https://t.co/aXFcH1dzVO

name: TheAtlantic
text: Both Barack Obama's recent memoir and The Crown's depiction of Margaret Thatcher are exercises in mythology, @TomMcTague writes: https://t.co/6lIlgUnLj0
